page.title: 02FARMING NURSERIES FARMS
page.content: {BOURNE HILL NURSERY.}WE ASKED MR.BAKER THE OWNER SOME QUESTIONS.IT ALL STARTED AFTER THE WAR IN 1945.IT HAS BEEN IN THE FAMILY ALL THE TIME.MR.BAKER HAD TWO ACRES OF LAND AND FIVE GREENHOUSES.MR.BAKERS FATHER HAD THE IDEA TO START THE NURSERY.THE HOURS HAVE CHANGED SINCE THE NURSERY OPENED.MR.BAKER DOES HAVE CHILDREN BUT THEY DON'T HELP OUT ON THE NURSERY.THEY HAVE THREE GREENHOUSES FULL OF TOMATO PLANTS. MR.BAKER IS MORE INTERESTED IN FLOWERS THAN VEGETABLES.THE FLOWERS SELL BEST IN WINTER AND WORST IN SUMMER.THEY BUY ABOUT THREE QUARTERS AND GROW ABOUT ONE QUARTER OF THE VEGETABLES.HE GETS MORE CUSTOMERS NOW THERE IS A DEVELOPMENT IN SOUTHWATER.THEY GET ABOUT 50 CUSTOMERS A DAY.THEY THOUGHT THE BUSINESS WOULD GROW IN THE FUTURE.
